Description: Rim sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky black with reserved band at rim; part of lotus and rosette with pomegranates in added white outline and added red centres; exterior: diagonal stroke pattern at rim between pairs of black bands; below, rosette as filling ornament; surface chipped off on upper left and lower right of sherd.
Curator's comments: Lemos describes the sherd as belonging to the Group of Light-Walled Naukratis Animal Chalices. All sherds in this group are small and offer very little by way of information beyond the fact that they come from light-walled chalices. The decoration on sherds belonging to this group is also poorly or carelessly drawn (Lemos 1991, 93).
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 254, no. 434)
Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (p. 50, pl. V, no. 5) (interior)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0552) (phase 2)
